title.narrative: F.a: ESRP Climate Change adaptive agriculture

description.narrative: 1. Project: 11873 Climate change adaptive agriculture project#2. Project area and Country: Pursat province in Cambodia #3. Project justification: #Cambodia is generally regarded as one of the worlds most vulnerable countries to the impacts of climate chang e and the extreme weather conditions are likely to be exacerbated in the future. Dependency on rain-fed agriculture and limited adaptive capacity make the country even more vulnerable to the impacts of the climate change. The expected long-term impacts wil l worsen the existing risks Cambodia is already facing, especially flooding. Pursat province is affected both by floods and droughts, which have affected local food production and increased food-insecurity. #4. The main objective and the expected results:# The main objective of the Climate change adaptive agriculture project is to improve the capability of vulnerable youths, children and community members to adapt to the impacts of climate change and enhance resilience to disasters. The project will focus on Disaster Risk Reduction (DRR) and Climate Change Adaptation (CCA) to build the capacity in vulnerable communities by educating youth and children in primary schools on DRR and CCA. At the end of the project, vulnerable community members, youths, and schoo l-children will have improved capacity in DRR/CCA and to cope with disaster risks and climate change impacts. Land managed under climate resilience practices and water use efficiency by women and men will increase.#5. Right-holders/ beneficiaries: 3,130 pe ople (school children, youth and community members)#Duty bearers: Government officials working on DRR from provincial and district levels, parents, commune counsellors, school principals, and teachers#6. Implementing partner: Life With Dignity (LWD)
